programmes.show_description: Talented tattoo artists transform extreme inking disasters into walking works of art, starting with Ryan's bad holiday ink and Adam's lasting reminder of his ex.
The series reaches its majestic climax. Who will win Greg Davies' coveted golden head and become only the seventh Taskmaster champion in history?
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Roisin Conaty take on Jon Richardson and Nish Kumar. Adam Buxton joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
Singer-songwriter, actor and author Jewel dons a disguise as an event planner to go undercover and meet talented musicians and artists who are struggling to get their big break.
Stephanie McMahon, former women's champion and current chief brand officer of the WWE, goes undercover to meet aspiring wrestlers and fans and help make their dreams a reality.
In Somerset, Jacqueline and Stephen's taste of the Med competes with Jess and Fred's Portuguese menu, and Rob and Simon's homegrown grub, in a week featuring dancing and a royal revelation.
In Newcastle, Sharna and Silvar serve up family favourites and a song and dance. Charlotte and Russ plan an Italian feast. And Shannon and Max take their rival diners on a culinary journey.
...Selling: Ex footballer Adesola and his wife Jennifer are hoping for that winning feeling by scoring a big sale. When a key deal falls through, there's some last-minute drama...
The One in a Furniture Store: Celina wants an elegant, intimate wedding in a historical building, but Ben has other ideas. He has visions of them saying 'I do' in a huge furniture store.
The One with the DIY Wedding Dress: Nikki dreams of getting married in the lap of luxury, somewhere warm and indoors, but Jamie wants to create his own Wedfest at a glamping site.
TGI Fridays is one of the biggest restaurant chains. CEO Ray Blanchette wants to re-energise the brand, so he goes undercover to find out what staff think of his changes.
Xavier Mufraggi, the CEO of Club Med North America, goes undercover, disguised as a laid-back surfer, in his own resorts, to see the impact that his growth plans are having.
Olde Hitching Post: Gordon visits the historic Olde Hitching Post restaurant in Massachusetts. Tom bought the business for his daughter but refuses to let her run it.
Levanti's: Gordon visits Pennsylvania, where he meets siblings whose inability to work together is risking their father's life savings at his Italian restaurant, Levanti's.
...and Selling: Brand new series: Sunita and David face time constraints and significant sacrifices to try and buy a cheaper home. But will Sunita sign on the dotted line?
Love Boat: The guests are greatly pleased when Captain Glenn dresses up for their themed dinner. Gary struggles with his feelings about Colin and Daisy hooking.
The race continues for Taskmaster Greg Davies' golden head trophy. Lou Sanders acquires some creepy facial hair.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and David Mitchell go up against Jon Richardson and Katherine Ryan. The Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas take on Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Caroline has to be cruel to be kind, while Joanna and Statham struggle to conceal the incident with the stuffed heron. Sue turns private dick and Martin comes into some money.
Glamour model Bex wants to put her Jedward tattoo behind her. Annie hopes to fix a tattoo that, after a mid-inking disagreement, didn't turn out as she'd expected.
The race continues for Taskmaster Greg Davies' golden head trophy. Lou Sanders acquires some creepy facial hair.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and David Mitchell go up against Jon Richardson and Katherine Ryan. The Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
Ground-breaking model, author and body activist Ashley Graham dons a disguise to go undercover and meet people who hope to break into the fashion world.
Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Seal adopts a disguise to go incognito among some undiscovered but talented musicians who are struggling to make it in the music industry.
In Glasgow, there's karaoke, edible bowls and a bizarre game of musical chairs, as Kirsty and Alistair, Mark and Claire, and Elvis impersonator Adrian and Amanda compete.
In Belfast, Sarah and Paddy do fine dining. Emma and Samson serve up Mozambican treats. And Louise and Danny's night features some model behaviour and a meringue mountain!
...Selling: Pastor Chris and Jennifer's home is not suited to nine children, especially with only one bathroom. Can Drew and Jonathan provide a moving miracle?
The One with the Childhood Sweethearts: Liza pictures a country estate with a plush marquee and a wedding reception filled with elegance. Dean wants to recreate a 1980s Valentine's disco...
The Thomas Shelby Wannabe One: Jane wants a country house wedding extravaganza, but Colm chooses a 1920s-themed reception at a race track featuring gangsters, gambling and the Charleston.
As CEO, Wan Kim has doubled Smoothie King's number of stores and tripled sales. He goes undercover to find out what his changes have meant for his employees and customers.
Colie Edison created every element of the bowling giant Bowlero. Now she goes undercover to find out how the brand is working for staff and customers.
Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room: In California, Gordon visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room, where he tries to mend relationships between the owner, his wife and their children.
Nino's: Gordon visits Long Beach in California to save Nino's, a failing Italian restaurant that opened in 1958 and is now under the misguided leadership of eldest son Nino.
...and Selling: Brand new series: Eric and Misty's DIY projects cause housing havoc. Before Drew can find their next place, they must prioritise agreeing on their priorities.
Loose Lips Sink Friendships: Everyone has a day off, and even Captain Glenn recharges. Gary sees Daisy and Colin getting closer, so makes a confession to Daisy.
Greg Davies judges the efforts of five keen comics. Joe Thomas struggles with the definition of a mammal. Sian Gibson sends Greg a NSFW text.
Jimmy Carr hosts as guest captain David Walliams and Jonathan Ross take on Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr hosts as guest captain Lee Mack and Catherine Tate take on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Paranoia reaches breaking point for Joanna and Statham, and they're forced to take drastic action. Mac, Guy and Martin make an offer to Caroline that she can't refuse.
